title: India asks Twitter to take down some tweets critical of its COVID-19 handling

title: Covid-19 lockdown extended in Delhi by a week till May 3: CM Arvind Kejriwal
description: The rules of the lockdown will remain the same. Only essential services and government offices will be allowed to function. All those employed with private offices will have to work from home. Malls, spas, gyms and auditoriums will be shut during the lockdown period while groceries, dairies are allowed to be kept open.

title: Indian hospitals plead for oxygen, country sets virus record
description: NEW DELHI (AP) — India put oxygen tankers on special express trains as major hospitals in New Delhi begged on social media on Friday for more supplies to save COVID-19 patients who are struggling to breathe. More than a dozen people died when an oxygen-fed fire ripped through a coronavirus ward in a populous western state. India’s underfunded health system is tattering as the world’s worst coronavirus surge wears out the nation, which set a global record in daily infections for a second straight day with 332,730. India has confirmed 16 million cases so far, second only to the United States in a country of nearly 1.4 billion people. India has recorded 2,263 deaths in the past 24 hours for a total of 186,920.

title: Delhi Covid lockdown news: National capital logs record fresh 306 deaths, over 26,000 cases  - The Times of India
description: Delhi recorded its highest spike in infections as well as deaths on Tuesday with 28,395 new cases and 277 fresh deaths due to Covid-19 reported in the past 24 hours. The positivity was recorded at 32.8%, meaning every third sample tested was positive. The actual number of infected patients is much higher and it is not being picked up due to delays or, in many cases, no testing, doctors said.

title: Delhi sees record 306 Covid-19 deaths in a day, over 26,000 new cases

title: 1,500 Delhi Police personnel test positive in Covid-19 second wave
description: The Delhi Police has intensified patrolling across the city due to the stringent curbs announced by the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) government in view of spiralling Covid-19 cases.
